alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:51PM MDT until June 09 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cameron Peak burn scar in... Southern Larimer County in north central Colorado... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. Up to 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pennock Pass. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie, Upper Buckhorn along County Road 44H, Crystal Mountain, Poudre Springs, Monument Gulch, Upper Pingree Park Road and The Retreat. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
